issue.title: Remote-to-remote moving/renaming does not work on Storj (but Storj cli 'uplink' supports it)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Assuming rclone v1.58.0-beta.5960.a667e03fc win64

- Mount a storj remote storage with command
rclone.exe mount --vfs-cache-mode=writes Storj_remote_storage: Z:

- Copy local file C:\anything.txt to remote Z:\bucket\anything.txt

- Rename file Z:\bucket\anything.txt to Z:\bucket\anything1.txt GIVES AN ERROR
This operation is possible with storj cli via command
uplink mv sj://bucket/anything.txt sj://bucket/anything1.txt

- Move file Z:\bucket\anything.txt to Z:\bucket\folder\anything.txt GIVES AN ERROR
This operation is possible with storj cli via command
uplink mv sj://bucket/anything.txt sj://bucket/folder/anything.txt

- Copy file Z:\bucket\anything.txt to Z:\bucket\anything1.txt doesn't give error

Log of error follows:
2022/01/27 19:06:23 ERROR : ntua/Οδηγίες.pdf: Dir.Rename error: Fs "FS sj://" can't rename files (no server-side Move or Copy)
2022/01/27 19:06:23 ERROR : ntua/Οδηγίες.pdf: Dir.Rename error: Fs "FS sj://" can't rename files (no server-side Move or Copy)
2022/01/27 19:06:23 ERROR : IO error: Fs "FS sj://" can't rename files (no server-side Move or Copy)

body: What does your rclone.conf look like with the keys/secrets removed?

[sj0]
type = s3
provider = Storj
access_key_id = jvuhxwnzda7o4gwlyeqgyhudze
secret_access_key = 
endpoint = gateway.eu1.storjshare.io
chunk_size = 64Mi

We don't current allow `provider = Storj` to have access to rename on s3 as when we implemented that it didn't work.

It may work now though, let me give it a test...

It did work, so here is a version of rclone which should work for you - can you give it a go please?

[v1.61.0-beta.6534.3daaeeea3.fix-6550-storj-copy](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6550-storj-copy/v1.61.0-beta.6534.3daaeeea3.fix-6550-storj-copy/) on branch [fix-6550-storj-copy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6550-storj-copy) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
it works perfectly. No errors. When will this added to the stable version?

Thank you for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.61 and v1.60.1 which should be out in a week or two.

The issue still exists on the latest rclone stable & beta versions.

> We don't current allow `provider = Storj` to have access to rename on s3 as when we implemented that it didn't work.
> 
> It may work now though, let me give it a test...
> 
> It did work, so here is a version of rclone which should work for you - can you give it a go please?
> 
> [v1.61.0-beta.6534.3daaeeea3.fix-6550-storj-copy](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6550-storj-copy/v1.61.0-beta.6534.3daaeeea3.fix-6550-storj-copy/) on branch [fix-6550-storj-copy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6550-storj-copy) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

The above versions also failed to resolve the issue.
@Baneeishaque please make a new issue with full details - thanks
I can confirm that it does not work on the stable and just tried it also doesn't work anymore on the beta. It used to work when i used it a week before.

This worked fine for me on the beta

    rclone moveto -vv TestStorj:rclone/file2.txt TestStorj:rclone/file3.txt

What did you try? What error message did it give?

It gives different errors for some reason everyday i try::

the first command 
`rclone move sj0:rajesh/"econ -main2.apkg" sj0: -P -vv`

gives error: 
`<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "move" "sj0:rajesh/econ -main2.apkg" "sj0:" "-P" "-vv"]

Failed to move: InvalidParameter: 1 validation error(s) found.
- minimum field size of 1, HeadObjectInput.Key.`

then i tried moveto:

`rclone moveto sj0:rajesh/"econ -main2.apkg" sj0: -P -vv`

gives output:

<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "moveto" "sj0:rajesh/econ -main2.apkg" "sj0:" "-P" "-vv"]
<7>DEBUG : rclone: systemd logging support activated
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "sj0:rajesh/econ -main2.apkg"
<7>DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/rajesh/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
<7>DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "sj0:rajesh/econ -main2.apkg", "sj0:rajesh"
"sj0:" is a directory

Interestingly, when i try to put that file to root of remote with moveto or move you get the respective results shown in above replies. 
However, when i try to move the file to another folder with moveto it gives the same responce as moveto to root of remote, but when using move to move to another folder it works. 

`rclone move sj0:rajesh/"econ -main2.apkg" sj0:sj-credentials/ -P -vv`

output:

<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "move" "sj0:rajesh/econ -main2.apkg" "sj0:sj-credentials/" "-P" "-vv"]

<7>DEBUG : 5 go routines active

Actually all the things i have done so far have been folder to folder so I never thought about this. I don't think this is a problem with rclone but how storj allows files to be stored. If i remember correctly every file has to be in a bucket and cannot exist at the root. So rclone is doing the right thing and we are doing it wrong. I think.
If this is a case then rclone is working perfectly on the stable and the beta that you linked.

However, i am not sure why moveto did not work in the correct scenario, am I using it wrong?

That's a cryptic error for trying to move something into the root!

Remember you need to name the destination file with moveto so

> rclone moveto sj0:rajesh/"econ -main2.apkg" sj0:bucket/destination.apkg -P -vv
